aria-allowed-attr-1.title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not match their roles
aria-allowed-attr-1.description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn how to match ARIA attributes to their roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-attr).

items.snippet: <span class="mw-customtoggle-Birth mw-customtoggle" style="font-size: 20px !important; color: rgb(11, 11, 236) !important;" aria-expanded="true" tabindex="0">
items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="true"

aria-allowed-role-2.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-2.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <label id="mw-sidebar-button" class="mw-checkbox-hack-button mw-ui-icon mw-ui-button mw-ui-quiet mw-ui-icon-eleâ€¦" for="mw-sidebar-checkbox" role="button" aria-controls="mw-panel" data-event-name="ui.sidebar" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element
